text: for me scuba diving in a lot of the

able to understand the nuance and to
connect with the experts and the peers
in that field and I think that you know
the level that I have gone in in diving
is sufficient for me to connect the
diving world to the other worlds that
I'm involved in many of the students at
the media lab have three or four
disciplines that they
are deep in they're probably deeper than
I am in my diving unlike me they tend to
have phds in every area of their
interest the reason I became an
instructor rather than just a scuba
diver is that teaching scuba diving um
that they have more tools for scuba
diving instructors than our teachers do
in elementary schools it's really almost
sad the way they teach you how to teach
is incredibly well done and you know and
scuba diving is also very experienced
Bas and I love working with young kids
like junior high school kids you say you
got to learn Bo's law because in an hour
will be in the water and we'll be
playing with stuff and unless you
understand what's going on you could
hurt yourself or now you have to
understand you know the biology and you
have to understand fish ID because this
fish is poisonous and this one isn't and
and and you you you're you're teaching
these kids physiology and chemistry and
physics and and you know and ecology and
every single lesson you can say and
because in an hour we'll be in the water
and you'll be doing this and it's really
for me this kind of perfect interest
driven learning thing and you find that
a lot of the kids who are doing terribly
in school are extremely engaged when
they're doing scuba diving because
they're so interested in learning this
stuff because they get to play with it
right away and so for somebody like me
who grew up not I'm always being
frustrated because I wasn't sure why I
was learning this thing scuba diving is
great because you know exactly why
you're learning everything that you're
learning and so I'm thinking about the
way we teach scuba diving and trying to
see whether we can apply some of that in
um in in some of the more formal
education that we do
